business.headline: Is the IPO craze over? Stock market correction hits public listingsSubscription figures for IPOs have dropped in recent months. Global economic uncertainty, rising interest rates, and tighter liquidity have made investors cautious.

Can you expect major income tax changes in Budget 2025? Check detailsThe Finance Ministry has established 22 specialised sub-committees to examine various aspects of the Income Tax Act, with an aim to simplify tax structures, expand tax base, and balance revenue generation.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Gautam Adani never attended our meetings: Devendra Fadnavis rejects chargeAfter Ajit Pawar claimed that Gautam Adani was present in the BJP-NCP government formation talks in 2019, Devendra Fadnavis clarified that the industrialist was never involved in such meetings.

Cocaine worth Rs 900 crore seized in Delhi, Amit Shah praises anti-drug effortsThe NCB recovered over 82 kg of cocaine from west Delhi and arrested two people in connection with the bust. The consignment was valued at around Rs 900 crore.

BCCI flags Pak board's plan to host Champions Trophy tour in POK: SourcesThe Indian cricket board has raised its concerns with the International Cricket Council over Pakistan's plan to host the Champions Trophy tour in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (PoK). ICC sources have told India Today that it would announce plans for the trophy tour soon.

Indians going to US for master's degree a scam? Reddit user sparks stormA Reddit user, claiming to be a 26-year-old American woman, said 99% of the students in her computer science master's degree class were Indians. She asked if Indians going to the US for masters was a scam and sparked a massive debate on Reddit and X. People, including tech influencer Deedy Das, revealed the ground reality.

How bloody siege of Mecca Grand Mosque 45 years ago split Muslim worldExactly 45 years ago, Mecca Grand Mosque, Islam's holiest place, was taken over by 200 armed men led by preacher Juhayman al-Utaybi. Blood would flow before the weeks-long siege ended. The events of 1979 turned Saudi Arabia into a radical Sunni country, and split the Muslim world, the impact of which is felt to this day.

2 killed as teens race on Srinagar highway, speeding car rams parked truckThe accident took place when four teenagers, in two SUVs, raced on the highway and one of the vehicles lost control and rammed a parked truck in Srinagar.

A redemption fifty from Samson and a brisk one also from Tilak are holding the full momentum over South Africa.

UK PM's office apologises after row over non-veg food, alcohol at Diwali receptionPrime Minister Keir Starmer's office issued an apology on Friday for a "mistake" in the organisation of its Diwali reception at 10 Downing Street after receiving criticism for including non-vegetarian food and alcohol at the event.

Haka: How a Māori tradition became New Zealand's cultural iconThe haka is not merely a dance; it is a powerful narrative of the Māori people's resilience, heritage, and connection to their ancestors. Each step and chant is a declaration of identity, making the haka a timeless bridge between the past and the present. Here is more about its origin and significance.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna.
